p: The total polyphenols, total phenolic acids and total flavonoids contents in C. nutans leaves extracted aqueously at temperatures of 25 and 100 °C were evaluated and the results are presented in Table 5. The results show that at an aqueous temperature of 100 °C, cultured tissue and conventionally propagated leaves recorded higher total polyphenols, phenolic acids and flavonoids contents than at an aqueous temperature of 25 °C.
